DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Lumbar Puncture Cerebrospinal Fluid Negative Finding Outcome Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a finding of normality in any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting in which a thin needle called a spinal needle is put into the lower part of the spinal column to collect cerebrospinal fluid around the brain and spinal cord.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Lumbar Puncture Cerebrospinal Fluid Negative Finding Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a finding of normality in any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting in which a thin needle called a spinal needle is put into the lower part of the spinal column to collect cerebrospinal fluid around the brain and spinal cord.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A procedure in which a thin needle called a spinal needle is put into the lower part of the spinal column to collect cerebrospinal fluid or to give drugs.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

An invasive procedure in which a hollow needle is introduced through an intervertebral space in the lower back to access the subarachnoid space in order to sample cerebrospinal fluid or to administer medication.

Property.preferredDefinition: (seh-REE-broe-SPY-nal) The fluid flowing around the brain and spinal cord. Cerebrospinal fluid is produced in the ventricles in the brain.:A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.
A finding of normality following an examination or investigation looking for the presence of a microorganism, disease, or condition.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
